text: we move on now to a very special segment
when we award a few very special degrees
the university recognizes and honors the
Monumental achievements of these select
individuals for the sum of their
contributions to their professions and
the public SMU is proud to confer
honorary doctorate degrees on two
Extraordinary
Gentlemen first may we invite the very
enthusiastic Vice Provo and Dean of the
school of Information Systems up on
stage to deliver the citation for first
honory degree recipient Dr John S brown
Professor Steven Miller
please good
morning the Singapore management
University confers an honorary doctor of
Information Systems degree upon John
cely Brown in recognition of his
outstanding record as a scientist
scholar and innovator in information and
Communications technology or ICT for
short for his assessments of the
business and economic impacts of ICT and
for using ICT to enhance the science and
practice of learning
John has been responsible for or
involved in some of the most significant
advances in ICT research development and
practice over the past three decades his
insights and observations on ICT Trends
are sought out by private and public
sector leaders worldwide his unique way
of looking at IC developments and Trends
within the broader social context is
highly
acclaimed while John has been an
important contributor to IC development
through his prior work as a researcher
laboratory director corporate board
director advisor and entrepreneur he
also maintains a healthy skepticism
about whether or not change Always
represents genuine
progress when John served as the
Director of the highly acclaimed Xerox
Palo Alto Research Center he EXP stand
at the role of corporate research to
include such topics as the management of
radical Innovation organizational
learning complex adaptive systems and
nanotechnologies he was a co-founder of
the institute for research on learning
his research
includes digital youth culture digital
media and institutional Innovation the
social context and social influences of
learning and the role of technology in
business and
education John is an inducted member
into the American Academy of Arts and
Sciences and the National Academy of
Education he is also a fellow of the
American Association for artificial
intelligence and the American
Association for the advancement of
science he is a former truste of the
MacArthur Foundation some people know
this as the foundation that gives out
the so called genius Awards he serves on
numerous public boards including the
boards of Amazon and Corning the famous
glass company and on many private Boards
of directors he has published over a 100
papers in scientific journals he has
co-authored numerous influential books
he has received the annual McKenzie
prize for the best article in Harvard
Business review on two separate
occasions John received a Bachelor of
Arts from Brown University in
1962 majoring in math and physics and a
PhD from the University of Michigan in
1970 majoring in computer and
communication
Sciences now up to this point in time
John has actually received six other
honorary degrees believe it or not he's
received an honorary doctor of science
from three different universities from
Brown University where he graduated as
an undergrad from the University of
Michigan and from North Carolina State
University he also has an honorary
doctor of Science and economics from the
London Business School an honorary
doctor of Humane letters from Claremont
Graduate University and an honorary
doctor of design from The Illinois
Institute of
Technology and that's why we are so
proud to be the very first that gives
John what we think is the honorary
degree that is really most befitting for
him and that's the honorary doctor of
information systems and why is that
because what is information systems it's
not only the technology of information
and um it as some people might call it
it's the information itself it's about
the way people use it it's the people
who use it and the setting in which they
use it and John has been exemplary in
bringing all of the these things
together and he's been an inspiration to
our school just very briefly to mention
John has been an active contributor to
our school of information systems since
2006 when he's been on our Advisory
Board and I want everyone sitting in the
audience to know that John has done his
national service and he's done quite a
bit of it he has served on a number of
very important Singapore panels and
advisory boards for our Ministry of
Education our media development
Authority
and our national Research Foundation

second honorary degree recipient Dr
chance kyong Professor Yong min
please
good
morning the Singapore management
University confers an honorary doctor of
laws lldd degree upon chanet kyong in
recognition of his remarkable
contributions to the development of the
legal sector in Singapore as attorney
general and subsequently as chief
justice Dr Chan has always been a
Pioneer achieving several notable firsts
he was among the inaugural batch of law
graduates from the University of Malaya
in 1961 and he was the first Singapore
law graduate to be admitted to the
Federal Bar of Malaya in
1962 he was the first person to be
appointed judicial commissioner in
1986 among the the first to be named
senior councel in 1997 and the first
person to have held consecutive
appointments as judicial commissioner
judge Attorney General and chief justice
chief justice Chan became the first
Singaporean and local law graduate to
become an honorary Venture of the honor
honorable Society of Lincoln's in
England in
2008 then in 2019 he was the first Asian
to receive the international jurists
award for outstanding contributions to
the administration of justice and
enhancing the Dignity of the Judiciary
in Asia Dr Chan was practitioner when
the pen electric Industries company
collapsed in 1985 due to unsettled
forward contracts it was the largest
corporate uh collapse in Singapore's
history and it forced the stock
exchanges of both Singapore and Malaysia
to shut down for 3 Days Dr Chan was
called upon to draft agreements to
extend credit from Banks to the
insolvent stock broking firms these
skillfully drafted agreements restored
liquidity to the system and ensured the
survival of the stock exchange and
helped Singapore to maintain its
standing as a financial center while
serving as chief justice Dr Chan was
asked by the governments to appear as
Council for Singapore in the
international court of justice at the he
in the pedal branka dispute together
with Professor Juma Professor Tommy Co
and others he presented Singapore's case
lucidly and the icj decisively upheld
Singapore's sovereignty over the island
as attorney general uh Dr Chan proved to
be firm and fair but bold and humble he
earned the respect of the legal
profession by emphasizing the importance
of an independent bar when advising the
government on legal policy and
regulation he also established the
technological infrastructure for legal
research and services uh and defined the
country's strategic legal needs on his
appointment as Chief Justice on 11th of
April 2006 he maintained an unrelenting
determination to uphold the rule of law
to build respect for the Integrity of
Law and to ensure a fair judicial
process he also tirelessly sought to
promote cooperation amongst the
Judiciary the bar the legal service as
well as law academics Chan Kang's
initiatives as chief justice were a
highly significant factor in building a
judicial system in Singapore that is
equal to the very best in the world
